item.title: Donna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Donna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Pam's father had been diagnosed with rectal cancer. It didn't surprise me. Put a bunch of white assholes together and you're going to find that going around." -- Stephen King

item.title: Donna add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You are constantly invited to be what you are." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Donna add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Donna add a quote by Descartes
item.description: "It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well." -- Descartes

item.title: Donna add a quote by Oprah Winfrey
item.description: "Forgiveness is giving up the hope that the past could have been any different." -- Oprah Winfrey

item.title: Donna add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "The moral dilemma is to make peace with the unacceptable" -- May Sarton

item.title: Donna add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Donna add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Writing is the art of applying the ass to the seat." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Donna add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Donna add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Change isn't easy... changing the way you live means changing what you believe about life. That's hard... When we make our own misery, we sometimes cling to it even when we want so bad to change because the misery is something we know. The misery is comfortable." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Donna add a quote by Daniel C. Dennett
item.description: "If you can approach the world's complexities, both its glories and its horrors, with an attitude of humble curiosity, acknowledging that however deeply you have seen, you have only scratched the surface, you will find worlds within worlds, beauties you could not heretofore imagine, and your own mundane preoccupations will shrink to proper size, not all that important in the greater scheme of things." -- Daniel C. Dennett

item.title: Donna add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "To be, in a word, unborable.... It is the key to modern life. If you are immune to boredom, there is literally nothing you cannot accomplish" -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Donna add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Their house had real hardcover books in it, and you often saw them lying open on the sofa, the words still warm from being read." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Donna add a quote by Jodie Foster
item.description: "Normal is not something to aspire to, it's something to get away from." -- Jodie Foster

item.title: Donna add a quote by Rebecca Cantrell James Rollins
item.description: "He counted his steps. That was how you got through tough things. You counted. Once you said, "one," then you knew "two" was coming, and "three" right after that." -- Rebecca Cantrell James Rollins

item.title: Donna add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Donna add a quote by Patricia Highsmith
item.description: "My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people." -- Patricia Highsmith

item.title: Donna add a quote by Louis Adamic
item.description: "My grandfather always said that living is like licking honey off a thorn." -- Louis Adamic

item.title: Donna add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "No matter how busy you may think you are, you must find time for reading, or surrender yourself to self-chosen ignorance." -- Confucius

item.title: Donna add a quote by Jodie Foster
item.description: "Books have always been my escape - where I go to bury my nose, hone my senses, or play the emotional tourist in a world of my own choosing... Words are my best expressive tool, my favorite shield, my point of entry...When I was growing up, books took me away from my life to a solitary place that didn't feel lonely. They celebrated the outcasts, people who sat on the margins of society contemplating their interiors. . . Books were my cure for a romanticized unhappiness, for the anxiety of impending adulthood. They were all mine, private islands with secret passwords only the worthy could utter. If I could choose my favorite day, my favorite moment in some perfect dreamscape, I know exactly where I would be: stretched out in bed in the afternoon, knowing that the kids are taking a nap and I've got two more chapters left of some heartbreaking novel, the kind that messes you up for a week." -- Jodie Foster

item.title: Donna add a quote by Francois-Marie De Voltaire
item.description: "Sometimes we are less unhappy in being deceived by those we love, than in being undeceived by them." -- Francois-Marie De Voltaire

item.title: Donna add a quote by Robert Browning
item.description: "how sad and bad and mad it was - but then, how it was sweet" -- Robert Browning

item.title: Donna add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "If one wanted to depict the whole thing graphically, every episode, with its climax, would require a three-dimensional, or, rather, no model: every experience is unrepeatable. What makes lovemaking and reading resemble each other most is that within both of them times and spaces open, different from measurable time and space." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Donna add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag
